Sentencas: A novel integrated structure is introduced in order to produce power and heat through biomass fuel simultaneously.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This cycle has different sections including the gasification process, solid oxide fuel cell, gas turbine cycle, Rankine cycle, ORC, and hot air and water line.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The heat required for the gasifier agent and the air is supplied through heat recovery in this system.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In this article, wood chips are employed to supply the required fuel for a solid oxide fuel cell by gasification process.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Also, the heat of the SOFC outlet stream is employed for heating the inlet streams of the Rankine cycle, gas turbine, and ORC.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Both en-ergetic and exergetic analyses are considered in order to evaluate the performance of the proposed cycle.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: A sensitivity analysis is performed for observing the effects of the operational parameters on the output power and overall efficiency of the system.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results illustrate that the output power of the cycle is 152.8 MW, and the electrical and overall efficiencies are 51.43% and 81.13%, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Also, the highest portion of exergy destruction is allocated to the fuel cell, which is about 65 MW.(c) 2022
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of a wood chips-based cycle integrated with solid oxide fuel cell
